Rafiqa usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and then resells for more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is 150 AZN and this business is main source of financial income for her family. 

Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. She wants to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions. She applied for a 500 AZN loan to purchase one cow.

loans.use: to buy one cow.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 56 years old, and the single mother of two children aged 27 and 23. She sells clothes, a business she started three years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She has requested a first loan of KES 20,000 to purchase two bales of bed covers for sale. The profit she earns will be ploughed back to her business. She hopes for a brighter future.

loans.use: To purchase two bales of bed covers to sell.

loans.name: Synit's Group

texts.en:
Synit is thirty years old living in the Sa Ang district, Cambodia. She has three children, one daughters and two sons, all of whom are still in school. She has been involved in pig raising and rice farming for almost twenty years and she supplements her family’s income by planting vegetables to earn extra income. She is able to earn around KHR 22,300 per day from her current business. 

Synit has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the loan. She is now leading the other two members, one who has just joined and one who has been with VisionFund for one cycle, to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each to support their businesses. 

As the group leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy feeds for her pigs. She hopes this loan will enables her to expand her current business and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 52 years old. She lives in a small village of Bolnisi District with her brother – Vitali. They earn their living through an agricultural business. They have a milking cow from which they produce cheese. Part of the milk and cheese are used by the family, and the rest is sold locally. Also, they have pigs and a plot of land, where various fruits are grown: peaches, apricots, cherries and water-melon. Julieta and Vitali are especially busy with the plot during spring and summer seasons in order to ensure a good harvest in late summer which they sell on the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 400 Lari
 
Julieta requested a loan to purchase a milking cow. She will be able to produce and sell more cheese. Thus, she wants to expand her business in order to earn a good profit. With the increased profits, she will be able to reinvest in her agricultural business, as well as spend more on the daily needs of the family. As a result of the above-mentioned activities the living conditions of the family will improve.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow.

loans.name: Heydar

texts.en:
Heydar is a 39-year-old man, married with three children. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives with his family in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.   He breeds cows and cattle and sells milk and milk products as well as cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. Heydar has more than 10 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father who taught him the best ways to look after cattle.

Heydar usually buys small cattle, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and resells them for more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar. Milk and yoghurt he sells to the neighbors. Milk and meat selling brings him an income of 120 AZN per month. Milk and yoghurt, as well as meat are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma and always use yoghurt souse. Milk products are considered as very healthy and also present in everyday life.
   
This is only one financial income in his family and it is not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. Heydar applied for a loan of 1200 AZN to purchase two cattle and one milking cow.

loans.use: to buy two cattle and one milking cow.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 34 years old, married to Julius, and blessed with two children aged 13 and 10. She operates a grocery stall, a business she started five years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 7,000. 

She is requesting a first loan of KES 25,000 to purchase beans, vegetables and fruits to sell. The profit she earns will be ploughed back into her business. 

She hopes to do well in the business world and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To purchase beans, vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 30-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from one year to 14 years. She describes herself as a courageous, easygoing and humble woman. She operates a charcoal, grocery and retail shop where she sells charcoal, vegetables, fruits and household items. She has been involved in this business for nine years and employs staff members. Her business is located in a strategic residential area and her primary customers are residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be shortage of household items and charcoal for selling. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more cereals and charcoal for resale. Her business goal is to improve her retail shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children with profits that will be generated from the business.

loans.use: to buy more cereals and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is 53 years old. She lives in a small village of Marneuli District with her family: husband – Mekhak and two children (25 and 30 years old). The family members are busy with agricultural activities. They have bee-hives with bee colonies and produce honey. Also the family owns a vineyard and a plot of land, where various fruits are grown: apples, peaches, apricots and water-melon. They sell harvested products and honey on the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 600 Lari.

Karine requested a loan to install a gas tank in the family car. The family will sell their products on the local open market and in nearby villages using their own car with the gas tank. This will decrease the cost of transportation and will increase the income of the family. With this increased income, she will be able to expand her business. Due to the above-mentioned, the family’s living conditions will be improved.

loans.use: to install a gas tank in her car.

loans.name: Julia Marcelina

texts.es:
Julia es una mujer de 65 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona, desde hace muchos años por diversas circunstancias decidió separarse de su esposo con quien tuvo 2 hijos, quienes actualmente ya son adultos y viven con sus respectivas familias; Julia siempre ha sido una persona muy trabajadora, alegre y luchadora, que dedicó todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a sus hijos y lograr que sean hombres de bien; en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por las acogedoras calles de la ciudad en compañía de sus hijos y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Chanfainita para compartir todos juntos.  
Por iniciativa propia y gracias al apoyo de sus hijos, Julia puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, ella no cuenta con un local para sus ventas, por ello lo realiza de forma ambulatoria en el mercado central de su distrito, dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 8 horas diarias en las cuales puede atender un promedio de 45 clientes; Julia cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a que es recomendada por sus clientes por su buena atención y trato amable.
Julia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, tales como camisas, polos, blusas, pantalones, chompas, etc. tanto para hombres y mujeres de acuerdo a la estación; de esta manera tendrá un negocio mejor abastecido y podrá incrementar sus ventas e ingresos económicos, con los cuales espera ahorrar el dinero necesario para poder adquirir un puesto propio en el mercado de su ciudad donde pueda vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Julia is a 65-year-old woman who lives in the city of Ica, which is in the District of Parcona. Several years ago, due to various circumstances, she decided to separate from her husband. She has two sons who are now adults and live with their respective families. Julia has always been a hardworking, cheerful, and determined person. She has dedicated all of her efforts to helping her children get ahead and they have turned out to become outstanding men. In her free time, she enjoys strolling through the streets of the city with her children. On a few occasions, she will prepare the delicious dish “chanfainita” (a traditional Peruvian stew) for everyone to share.

Through her own initiative and with the support of her children, Julia started her own small business of selling clothes. She does not have a shop where she conducts her sales, so she must work as a street vendor at the central market in her district. Julia works approximately eight hours a day and can serve an average of 45 customers. She believes her business is doing well because customers have recommended her because of her good service and friendliness.

Julia is very grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the assistance they will provide, she can buy merchandise such as shirts, pullovers, blouses, trousers, sweaters, and other items for men and women according to the season. She will have a business that is well-stocked so that she can increase her sales and her income. Julia hopes to save enough money to acquire her own vending stall at the market in her city where she can sell her products.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pullovers, blouses, trousers, sweaters, and other items.

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en: Hiba is a 42-year-old married Lebanese woman. She lives with her husband and two young children who are still attending school. She has worked as a private teacher since 1989. She likes her occupation because she feels that she is helping learners to get the needed education. She has arranged a special room in her house where she receives her students and has equipped it with required materials and supplies. Alongside this, she has also worked as a teacher in a local school since 1998, to supplement her income. Her husband has worked as a journalist since 1993, and they cooperate to gather enough money to be able to pay their heavy life expenses. Today, Hiba is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a laptop and an iPad. She notes that these purchases will facilitate her work preparation and will help her make researches and studies which will improve her teaching skills. She is very positive about her future and wishes to receive more students with the coming school season.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop and an iPad

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en:
Mzia is 50 years old. She lives in a small village of Dmanisi District with her husband Tariel. Mzia and Tariel run an agricultural business. They have 2 milking cows and sell milk in nearby villages. Also, they have 6 sheep and sell lambs. In addition to livestock, they have bee-hives, with bee colonies which produce honey.
They also own a plot of land, where they grow wheat, maize and haricot beans. Mzia and Tariel are especially busy with the plot during spring and summer seasons in order to ensure a good harvest in late summer, which they sell on the local open market. In addition to their agricultural activities Mzia works in the village school as a primary teacher. Total average monthly income of the family is 1000 Lari.

Mzia requested credit for expansion of the dairy farm. She will purchase an additional milk cow, and will be able to produce dairy food, mainly cheese and curds. Mzia will sell additional produce on the local open market, where her products are quite popular among consumers. The income of the family will increase. With increased income they will be able to reinvest in the family agricultural business. Due to the above mentioned, living conditions of the family will improve.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Priskilla

texts.en:
Priskilla is 40 years old, married and blessed with five children aged 22, 18, 14, 12 and four years respectively. She operates a grocery stall, a business she started seven years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES. 6,000. 

She is requesting for a first loan of KES.10,000 to purchase fruits, vegetables and beans for sale. The profit she earns will be ploughed back to her business. 

She hopes to do well in the business industry.

loans.use: To purchase fruits, vegetables and beans for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more electronics items for sale

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is a 39-year-old married woman from Lebanon who lives with her husband and four school-aged children. She has owned a small store since 2006, and she sells wide variety of scarves. Her shop is located in her town next to her house and there are a good number of customers passing by her shop buying her products. This will be her second Kiva loan. It is positive to learn that she has indeed increased her sales and income since taking the first loan. And she was a very punctual client and has paid on time. With her requested loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, she will purchase an extended quantity of scarves. She has heavy demand for her products and she badly needs the loan as she must be in the requisition of her customers. She hopes that with the help of the loan, she will be able to augment her business sales and therefore increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase an extended quantity of scarves

loans.name: Elene

texts.en:
Elene is 50 years old. She lives in a small village in Bolnisi District with her family: husband George, and 27-year-old daughter. Her daughter has chronic health problems and gets a relevant pension from the local government. Elene and her husband are involved in the family business together. They work hard but their income is not enough to cover living expenses. They still live in poverty. They have a milking cow and a calf. Elene makes cheese every day and sells it on the local open market. They own 0.8 hectares of land, where wheat and maize are grown. Harvested products are sold on the local open market as well. Total average monthly income of the family is 500 Lari. 

Elene requested a loan for purchasing a milking cow. She will be able to produce and sell more cheese. Thus, she wants to expand her business in order to earn a good profit. With increased profits, she will be able to reinvest in her agricultural business, as well as spend more on the daily needs of the family. As a result of the above mentioned, activities and living conditions of the family will be improved.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 39-year-old married woman. She has four children whose ages ranging from one to 15 years old. She describes herself as honest, courageous and a risk-taker. She operates a retail store where she sells electronics such as televisions, radios, cables and phone accessories. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located near a college school and her primary customers are students and local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high transportation cost when getting electronics from the source. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy mattresses for her business. Her business goal is to diversify her business into a supermarket within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a chain of electronic shops in her home town.

loans.use: to buy mattresses to add to her retail store.

loans.name: Najwa

texts.en:
Najwa is a 32-year-old married woman living with her husband and three children who are still attending school. She is from Lebanon. Three years ago, she started her own business which consists of selling perfumes. She works on her own and sells her products in different areas and villages. Her husband who works in a maintenance local company assists her in paying the high costs of living especially the children's school fees. 

Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase perfume bottles and diverse scents in order to be able to produce particular perfumes with unique odors. She notes that the diversity of her merchandise will make her very attractive to customers which will enlarge her sales thus her profit. In the future, she plans to open her own store and in addition sell woman's accessories.

loans.use: purchase perfume bottles and diverse scents.

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is a 32-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four children, all attending school. In 2000, she started running her own shop selling toys, accessories, perfumes and souvenirs. Her income is important to help with her household expenses and pay her children’s school fees. Her story exemplifies the day-to-day challenges Lebanese women are facing in running a business and at the same time raising children and taking care of their houses. Her husband works in a local company and they cooperate together to meet the needs of life. 

Today, she is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to expand her store’s inventory of perfumes, accessories and toys. Her intention at this stage is to augment her sales so as to amplify her income. In the future, she is planning to add woman's bags and clothes into her shop.

loans.use: to expand her store’s inventory of perfumes, accessories and toys.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 43 years old and married. She runs a bicycle transport business and has one employee. She has been in this business for six years. As well as this, she sells snacks for extra income. She describes her business environment to be average. She hopes to operate a taxi transport business in the future. She needs a loan of 40,000 KES in order to buy a bicycle.

loans.use: To buy a bicycle

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 42 years old and has three children aged three,17 and 18. She operates a grocery store. She has been in the business for ten years and has one employee. She describes her business environment as competitive. Previously, she acquired a loan which helped her grow her business.

Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has been able to educate her children and expand her business because she has been trained in financial management. She hopes to operate a wholesale business in five years and open another outlet in a different location. She needs a loan of 50,000 KES to buy fruits, vegetables, and cereals.

loans.use: To buy fruits, vegetables and cereals.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort portal region of Uganda. He is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past two years, Robert has been working hard to manage his pharmacy, which sells medicine. 

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more medicine for resale, and will help Robert to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Robert hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business into a whole sale shop. 

Robert is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robert who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more medicine for resale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 27-year-old married man. He has two children who are two and six years old. He describes himself as a go-getter and a courageous man. He operates a butcher shop where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for seven years and employs three staff members. His business is located in a populated business area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be sometimes low purchasing power from the customers leading to spoiling of the meat. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy goat for meat and pay for the completion of the construction of the kitchen. His business goal is to buy a refrigerator for keeping left over meat within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy goat for meat and pay for the construction of the butcher's kitchen.

loans.name: Zakariyya

texts.en:
Zakariyya is a 21-year-old young man from Gaza. For three years, he has been working as an auto electrician. Zakariyya asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy some equipment for his auto shop so as to improve his work.

His future ambition is to be the best-known car electrician in the area and to improve his income.

loans.use: to buy some equipment for his auto shop.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with one of them currently in school. For the past two years, Harriet has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like sugar soap and salt for resale, and will help Harriet to generate greater profits and pay for her medical expenses. Harriet hopes that in the future she will be able to improve. 

Harriet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Harriet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like sugar, soap and salt for resale.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is 28 years old, married, and with one child. She operates a spare parts shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for two years. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has learnt how to save because she has been trained in financial management. She hopes to operate a wholesale business within the coming five years. She needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy spare parts.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Josue Gilberto

texts.es:
Josue, tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus tíos en la comunidad de Yorito, del departamento de Yoro, su madre y hermanos viven en otra aldea cercana.
Josue estudio una carrera técnica agrícola y empezó su motivación por establecer su propio negocio. Con sus propios esfuerzos lo logro. Hace un año el comenzó a comprar pollitos para cría y engorde para vender, ahora tiene clientes en su comunidad y a sus alrededores. Su negocio ha venido en crecimiento, cuenta con un vendedor quien distribuye el pollo en una motocicleta, el pollo lo destaza y la carne la pone en una hielera y sale a vender a los vecinos de la comunidad.  Actualmente solicita un préstamo por 15,000.00 Lempiras para capital de trabajo, con el cual va comprar alimento como ser concentrado para el pollo y también más pollito para cría y mantener siempre el negocio en marcha. Su meta es llegar a tener una granja de pollos con Mil pollos y quiere involucrar a su familia para ayudarse mutuamente, y ampliar el mercado.
texts.en:
Josue is 22 years old and single. He lives with his aunt and uncle in the community of Yorito, which is in the Department of Yoro. His mother and siblings lives in another neighborhood nearby.

Josue is studying for a technical degree in agriculture and became excited about starting his own business. Through his own efforts, he was able to accomplish his goal. A year ago, he started buying young chickens to raise and fatten for eventual resale. He now has customers in his community and in the surrounding areas. His business is starting to grow. Josue has a salesperson who distributes the chickens by motorcycle. The birds are butchered and the meat is placed in a cooler before being sold to residents of the community.

At the moment, Josue is requesting a loan of 15,000 HNL to use as operating capital. He will buy food for the chickens, such as concentrated feed, as well as young chickens to raise so that he can keep his business in operation. His goal is to have a poultry farm with 1,000 chickens. He wants to involve his family so that they can help one another and expand his market.

loans.use: to buy young chickens and concentrated poultry feed.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 41 years old and married. She operates a spare parts shop to earn a living. She has been in this business for seven years. She has one employee. She had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which has helped her grow her business. She hopes to operate a wholesale in five years. She needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy spare parts.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to sell

loans.name: Emilly

texts.en:
Emilly is 30 years old, married and blessed with three children that she supports. She runs a dairy milk shop and it has been in operation for the past five years earning a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

This is the first loan she has applied for from KADET Ltd., and she wants to purchase more milk from her suppliers and expand her business facility. This will lead to increased sales and more customer reach. The anticipated profits will support her business expansion plans. 

Her future plans are to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase more milk for her dairy milk shop.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is 30 years old and married. She sells clothes to earn a living. She has been in the business for eight years. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has improved her saving skills because she has been trained in financial management. She hopes to expand her business and increase her capital in five years. She needs a loan of 50,000 KES to buy more clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes.

loans.name: Abdel Salam

texts.en:
Abdel Salam is a 46-year-old married man living with his wife and four children; one of them is still attending school. After gaining 30 years of experience, he was able to open his own barbershop in 1992. Due to his good business reputation, he was able to build a good number of loyal customers and hire three full-time employees to help him in achieving work tasks. 

With his requested loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will purchase shaving tools and supplies in addition to vaporization machinery. In that way, he will satisfy his customer’s demands and serve them in the best way. He is positive about his business prospects and plans to open a new branch of his shop in the coming year.

loans.use: to purchase shaving tools and supplies in addition to vaporization machinery.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 37 years old and a married man with five children aged 16, 13, 10, six and four years old. He sells shoes, a business he started 17 years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 5,000.

He wants to purchase more shoes for sale and has requested for a first loan of KES 10,000 to aid in him getting more stock. 

The profit he makes from his business will help him educate his children. He dreams of having a prosperous life.

loans.use: To purchase more pairs of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort portal region of Uganda. He is single and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Jackson has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which does carpentry and also sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, Jackson has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale, and will help Jackson to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Jackson hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business into a wholesale shop. 

Jackson is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jackson who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 40 years old, married to Jane and blessed with three children. He has been hawking sweets, juices, biscuits and sodas for five years now and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

He has requested a first loan of KES. 10,000 to purchase more of these goods for sale. Profit made will be ploughed back into his business. His dream is to see his business grow big.

loans.use: To purchase sodas, biscuits, sweets and mineral water for sale.

loans.name: Batoul

texts.en: Batoul is a 33-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She is living with her parents and only sibling. She has worked as a hairdresser and beautician for the past 5 years. She works on a freelance basis and she also visits customers at their domiciles to provide them with her talented hairdressing and beauty services. In parallel, she owns a small apartment and she benefits from its rental fees. Today, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase beauty products and supplies. Specifically, she will buy a laser machine in addition to tattoo materials. She is well known in her region and neighboring towns by her good reputation and she is certain that with the new laser services, she will be able to attract more customers and therefore increase her income. In the future, she hopes to open her own beauty salon where she will receive her customers appropriately.

loans.use: to purchase a laser machine in addition to tattoo materials

loans.name: Asoson Asin Osur

texts.en:
Asin is a 29-year-old married man. He has two children. He describes himself as a determined man. He operates a chemist shop where he sells tablets. He has been involved in this business for more than three years. His business is located in a viable business environment and his primary customers are residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high prices of tablets. 

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy tablets. His business goal is to run a clinic within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business.

loans.use: To buy tablets.

loans.name: Rabinson

texts.en:
Rabinson is 33 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has five children with two of them currently in school. For the past two years, Rabinson has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, Rabinson has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale, and will help Rabinson to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Rabinson hopes that in the future he will be able to increase his stock which will attract more customers. 

Rabinson is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rabinson who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en: Angeline is 32 years old and married. She operates a beauty salon and has one employee. She has been in the business for two years. Besides, she operates a mobile phone money transfer (M-pesa) business. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has improved her savings because she has been trained in financial management. She hopes to grow her business and open another outlet in a different location. She needs a loan of 50,000 KES to buy a blow-drier.

loans.use: To buy a blow-drier.

loans.name: Fares

texts.en:
Fares is 34 years old. He is married and has five children, of which three are at school. Fares has been working a farm raising cattle since 2010. His work involves producing and selling dairy products. 

Fares asked Ryada for funds to buy more cattle and sheep for his farm to increase dairy production. His ambition is to increase his income and improve the life of his family and children by improving their educational level and supporting them to get university education.

loans.use: to buy more cattle and sheep for his farm.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is 33 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past five years, Jonathan has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, Jonathan has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale, and will help Jonathan to generate greater profits and increase the capital in the business. Jonathan hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business into a wholesale shop. 

Jonathan is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jonathan who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 52 years old and has three children. She sells clothes to earn a living. She has been in the business for seven years and has one employee. She operates her business in a busy environment with available customers. She hopes to operate a boutique in five years and open another outlet in a different location. She needs a loan of 100,000 KES to buy clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To level and clean up the agricultural land for use

loans.name: Josephat Ekwam

texts.en:
Josephat's business is doing great and he has managed to open a butchery where he can sell goat meat. He has requested a second loan of KES.50,000 to purchase 15 sheep at KES 30,000 and 10 goats at KES 20,000 to slaughter, and sell the meat to his growing clientele.

His profit will help him pay school fees for his children and purchase more livestock as well. His dream is to continue with his business as well as educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase 15 sheep with KES 30,000 and 10 goats with KES 20,000 to slaughter

loans.name: Roselyne

texts.en:
Roselyne is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. She is a married mother of one school-going child. Roselyne was invited to Milango by her friends and joined in order to access credit.

She is hereby asking for a loan of 21,100 Kenya Shillings to pay for her child’s education. Roselyne is grateful to Milango and its partners for such avenues which help improve the standards of living of many Kenyans.

loans.use: To pay for her child’s education.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 43-year-old cereals shop owner in Mariakani. He is a married father of four. He has been selling cereals for the past two years. His business is doing great.

This marks his fourth loan from KADET Ltd. to finance his business. He plans to purchase more maize, beans and cow peas to sell to his customers. 

He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children and repay his loan. He hopes to see all his children well educated and comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase more maize, beans and cow peas.

loans.name: Nicodemus

texts.en: Nicodemus is 32 years old, married, with one child. He operates a retail shop. He has been in the business for five years. In addition, he does farming to earn extra income. He has previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which has helped him grow his business. He hopes to expand his business in five years. He needs a loan of 120,000 KES to buy beans, maize, sugar and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy beans, maize, sugar, and maize flour.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She is a married mother of two school-going children. She owns a retail shop which has been in operation for three years and has been a source of constant income to the family. She received the start-up capital from her husband. In this shop, she sells sugar, cooking oil and washing detergents amongst other things. Besides this business, Grace is also a vendor of water.
She learnt of Milango from a company employee and joined in order to access credit for her business. Grace is asking for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings to purchase retail stock like cereal, sugar, cooking fat etc.
Grace is optimistic that her sales will increase and she will finally open another retail shop. Her desire is to increase her number of shops in future. The additional income obtained from this loan will help restock her shop and also pay for her children’s school fees. The only challenge that Grace faces is the inflation and high cost of purchasing stock.

loans.use: To purchase retail stock like cereal, sugar, cooking fat etc.

loans.name: Festus

texts.en:
Festus lives in the Coastal town of Changamwe, Kenya. He is a married father of six school-going children and operates a taxi business. The business has been running for eighteen years. 

Festus was introduced to Milango by his friends and is applying for a loan of 83,500 Kenya Shillings to repair his car and to repaint it to attract more customers. Festus’s car does not meet the standards and the taste of most of the current customers. His aim is to upgrade the type of vehicle he uses and he is ready to save the additional income from this loan towards purchasing another car in the future. The challenges he faces while doing this business are high fuel cost and low business seasons; he mostly rents out his vehicle and the area relies on tourists. The additional income will go towards his children’s education.

loans.use: To repair his car and to repaint it to attract more customers.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 35 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort portal region of Uganda. He is married and has four children with three of them currently in school. For the past three years, Godfrey has been working hard to manage his produce store, which sells dry food like maize flour. 

To help expand his business, Godfrey has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more maize flour, and beans for resale, and will help Godfrey to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Godfrey hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business into a bigger one so as to earn more capital. 

Godfrey is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Godfrey who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more maize flour, and beans for resale.

loans.name: Jerusha

texts.en:
Jerusha is 51 years old, with five children. She sells fruits and vegetables to earn a living. She has been in this business for nine years and has one employee. She describes her business environment to be competitive. Previously, she acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped her grow her business.

Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, Jerusha has acquired more skills on savings because she has been trained on financial management. She hopes to be rich in future. She needs a loan of 40,000 KES to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. He is a father of three children, though only one is still in school. He has been in the transport industry, owning a motorcycle for four years. Fred decided to supplement his income by taking photos while on trips.
He was introduced to Milango last year and is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenyan shillings to purchase a digital camera and photo printer. Fred is optimistic of overcoming the challenge of high cost of fuel and purchase of equipment/spares to achieve his goals. He believes the additional income from this loan will help him provide better education to his child.

loans.use: To purchase a digital camera and photo printer.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.fr: Daniel est âgé de 29 ans et vit au Bénin. Daniel n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Daniel est marié à un certain Akpéné. Le couple a six enfants à leur charge dont quatre constituent leurs propres enfants. Certains enfants sont scolarisés. Daniel vit ensemble ses enfants et sa femme. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour répondre aux divers besoins de la maison, Daniel vend la nourriture (sauce de viande de porcs. Daniel exerce cette activité depuis vingt ans dans sa région. Daniel s’approvisionne dans une autre région du Bénin. Grâce aux revenus que lui génère cette activité, Daniel contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa maison. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Daniel sollicite pour une deuxième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: Daniel is 29 years old and lives in Benin. He did not go to school and he is now married to a woman called Akpéné. The couple has six children in their care, four of whom are their own children. Some of the children are at school. Daniel lives with his wife and children. The couple cover the various household expenses between them. In order to provide for the family's various needs, Daniel sells food (sauces made with pork) and has been doing this for the past 20 years in his region. He gets his supplies in another region of Benin. Thanks to the income he generates from his business, Daniel is able to contribute to the various household expenses. In order to satisfy the demands of his ever-growing customer base, he is requesting a second loan from Alidé. The first loan has been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Solange

texts.fr: Solange est âgée de 36 ans et vit au Bénin. Solange a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Solange est mariée à un certain Arnaud. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Pour répondre à ses divers besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Solange exerce comme activité la vente de chaussures et de vêtements depuis près de cinq ans dans sa boutique au Bénin. Solange s’approvisionne au Ghana et à Lomé. Grâce aux revenus que lui génère ses activités, Solange contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa maison. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Solange sollicite pour une deuxième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement par Solange a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: Solange is 36 years old and lives in Benin. She left school at secondary level and is now married to a man called Arnaud. The couple has two children who are both at school. In order to provide for her various needs and those of her children, Solange has been selling shoes and clothes for almost five years in her shop in Benin. She gets her supplies in Ghana and in Lomé. Thanks to the income her business generates, Solange is able to contribute to the various household expenses. In order to be able to satisfy the demands of her ever-growing customer base, Solange is requesting a second loan from Alidé. The previous loan she was granted has been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Mamouna

texts.fr:
Mme MAMOUNA est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 05ans et le moins âgé a 02ans. Un  va à l’école. Elle a 04 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des pagnes  divers  depuis 05ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de secteur 10 en ville et au Mali. Ses clients sont les femmes.

Mme veut s’acheter 02 douzaines de pagnes hitarget et 01 lot de Bazin.

Elle épargne ses bénéfices pour ouvrir un atelier fixe et pouvoir réinvestir dans son commerce. Mme ambitionne agrandir son hangar de vente et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mamouna is married and mother to two children. The eldest of the children is five years old and the youngest two. One goes to school. Mamouna has four dependents.

She has been selling various types of "pagnes" (brightly coloured decorative pieces of fabric) for the past five years. She gets her supplies at the Sector 10 market in town and in Mali. Her customers are women. 

Mamouna wants to buy two dozen "Hitarget pagnes" and one batch of damask fabric. She is saving her profits so that she can buy a permanent workshop and reinvest in her business. Her ambition is to expand the shed where she sells her goods and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two dozen "Hitarget pagnes" and one batch of damask fabric.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is 38 years old. She is married and lives in a small village of the Dmanisi district with her husband  and 18-years-old daughter Gia. The family runs an agricultural business. They have a plot of land where they grow potatoes and maize. They sell harvested products at the local open market. 

In addition to the agricultural business Irma has a store in the village. She purchases kitchen utensils and miscellaneous household items in the wholesale market in Tbilisi (Capital of Georgia) and sells them in the village. Total average monthly income of the family is 1000 Lari.

To continue operating her business Irma requested a loan. Because of the high demand of her products, she plans to purchase more household items. She plans to add clothing and more kitchen utensils in her store. Irma will diversify the assortment of products for sale and attract new customers. This will increase the sales and Irma will be able to improve living conditions of the family. She hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase stock for the store.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 34 years old and is married with five children. She sells meat and has 15 years of experience in this work. She currently employs 3 people to help her. 

Christine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy a large quantity of meat to sell. With any profits she will be able to save money for her future and she will be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of meat to sell.

loans.name: Maria Gladys

texts.es: Doña Maria Gladys habitante Nueva Guinea es pequeña productora de esta zona, solicita su primer crédito para compra de un solar y ayudarle a su hijo menor, como una herencia  para que pueda realizar una pequeña vivienda, en la comunidad es conocida como una señora con excelente conducta, muy trabajadora, su deseo es ayudarle a su hijo, espera ser beneficiada para tener mejores condiciones de vida con su núcleo familiar.
texts.en: Maria Gladys lives in Nueva Guinea and is a small farmer in this area.  She is requesting her first loan to buy a plot of land to help her youngest son.  She would like to give it to him as an inheritance so that he can build a small house.  In her community, Maria Gladys is known as a hard-working lady of excellent conduct.  Her wish is to help her son.  She hopes to benefit so that she can enjoy better living conditions with her immediate family.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Alvaro Javier

texts.es: El sr. Alvarode 33 años de edad es acompañado, tiene 2 hijos que dependen economicamente de el. Solicita el credito para invertirlos en la compra de materiales de comstruccion para iniciar la construccion de su vivienda en un terreno de su propiedad y poco a poco ir acondicionando su propia vivienda.
texts.en: Alvaro is 33 years old and lives with his partner.  He has two children who are financially dependent on him.  He is requesting this loan to invest in buying building supplies so that he can start building a house on a plot of land that he owns and gradually prepare his own home for living in.

loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in Changamwe, Kenya. She is married and owns a vehicle spare parts shop; a business she began three years ago. After being introduced to Milango by her friends, Christine is now applying for a loan of Ksh 21,05. She will us her first loan in Milango to purchase spare parts to use in vehicle repairs such as vehicle oil, brake pads, reflectors and tail lamps. Besides this business, Christine also runs a salon.

The business has many customers due to the fact that there many vehicle garages operating in the area but without spare part shops. Christine faces the challenge of lack of capital to purchase stocks of spare parts. She looks forward to opening other centers in future and looks forward to owning a business premise instead of renting one.

She will use the extra income for the family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy spare parts such as vehicle oil, brake pads, reflectors and tail lamps.

loans.name: Rosmery Susan

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de artesania,la socia vende chompas,pantalones,chalinas y guantes,ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m ahsta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de su negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de artesania.La socia solicita el credito para comprar chalinas,pantalones y guantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues in her business selling handicrafts.  She sells sweaters, pants, scarves and gloves.  She works from 8.00am to 5.00pm and, through her business, she would like to make progress in life.  The member's dream is to expand her craft business.  She is requesting this loan to buy scarves, pants and gloves. 

The member is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy scarves, pants and gloves

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de pan,el socio elabora los panes y luego lo vende en forma ambulatoria,el socio trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta als 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño del socio es tener un local donde pueda vender los panes.El socio solicita el credito para comprar insumos para preparar los panes como azucar,leche,mantequilla y huevos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues in his business selling bread.  He bakes bread which he then sells as an itinerant street vendor.  He works from 7.00am to 6.00pm and, through this business, he provides for his children.  The member's dream is to have business premises from which to sell his bread.  He is requesting this loan to buy supplies for preparing his bread such as sugar, milk, butter and eggs.

The member is happy to be receiving his loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making bread such as sugar, milk, butter and eggs

loans.name: Yanett

texts.es:
La socia Yanett nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 47 años de edad, es casada fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene dos hijos, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Unión Latina” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

La socia Yanett se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y también se dedica a brindar servicio de transportes. La socia Yanett en esta oportunidad accede al crédito para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo perfumes, pulseras, aretes y otras cosas más.  

La socia Yanett agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Yanett was born in the city of Cusco and lives in the city in which she was born.  She is 47 years old, married and has two children from this beautiful relationship.  She is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Unión Latina" community bank.

Yanett's business is selling beauty products.  She also provides a transport service.  On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as perfumes, bracelets, earrings, etc.

Yanett is grateful for her loan and pledges to make her loan repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as perfumes, bracelets, earrings, etc.

loans.name: Javier Antonio

texts.es: Don Javier de 43 años de edad, es casado, trabaja como conductor para la Alcaldia. Solicita el credito para invertirlos en la construccion de un anexo en la parte delantera de su casa, area que servira para ampliar la vivienda y brindar mayor comodidad a la familia.
texts.en: Javier is 43 years old, married and works as a driver for the council.  He is requesting this loan to invest in building an extension on the front of his house.  This area will help expand his home and provide his family with greater comfort.

loans.use: to build an extension

loans.name: Mayry

texts.es: Mayry de 20 años de edad vive en el municipio de Puerto Colombia a orillas del mar caribe y muy cerca a la ciudad de Barranquilla. Allí tiene su propio negocio mediante el cual vende mercancía variada, mediante guías especializadas de productos, actividad que inició desde hace 1 año, por la necesidad de apoyar la gestión de su hogar, que hasta el momento estaba solo a cargo de su esposo, quien se desempeña como albañil. Así fue que, cuando consiguió la oportunidad de ofrecer mercancías por catálogos a empleados de varias empresas, emprendió su aventura emprendedora,  y así con mucho esfuerzo y disciplina ha logrado consolidarlo. Su principal clientela son vecinos, amigos, familiares, referidos, a quienes ofrece gran variedad de mercancías, como cosméticos, ropa, calzado, perfumería etc; para recuperar su dinero Mayry otorga a su clientela un plazo de 15 días a 1 mes. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará mercancía que llegó en sus catálogos con buenos descuentos, como cosméticos, calzado y ropa. Con ello aspira impactar con precios a sus compradores y ampliara la cobertura de clientes. Su crédito se fundamenta en la posibilidad de tener un buen surtido y no esperara a recoger el dinero de las cuentas por cobrar, para poder responder a su clientela y como siempre complacerlos para fidelizarlos y justamente garantizar el éxito de su inversión.
texts.en:
Mayry is 20 years old and lives in the town of Puerto Colombia, on the Caribbean coast, very close to the city of Barranquilla.  There she has her own business where she sells a variety of merchandise through specialized product guides.  She started this business one year ago as she needed to support her household.  Up to that point her husband, who works as a builder, was the only one providing.  

When Mayry got the opportunity to sell merchandise through catalogs to employees in different companies, she undertook the business venture and, with a lot of effort and discipline, she has managed to consolidate it.  Her main customers are neighbors, friends, family members and people who she has been recommended to.  She offers them a wide range of merchandise such as cosmetics, clothing, shoes, perfumes, etc.  Mayry gives her customers 15 days to 1 month to pay.  

Mayry is applying for a Kiva loan (her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo) to buy merchandise from her catalogs which are currently being offered with good discounts such as cosmetics, shoes and clothing.  In this way, she hopes to impress her buyers with her prices and expand her customer coverage.  Her loan will enable her to have a good amount of stock available and she will not have to wait to collect money on her outstanding accounts.  This will enable her to respond to her customers and, as always, make them happy so that they become loyal customers.  This will guarantee her investment is successful.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, shoes and clothing

loans.name: Maria Del Cisne

texts.es:
MARIA DEL CISNE tiene 23 años de edad es soltera tiene un hijo, vive con el hijo y la madre de 6 años de edad en Guaranda Provincia Bolívar.

MARIA DEL CISNE trabaja en un local en el área de atención al cliente. Solicita el crédito para pagar la matrícula la Universidad.

Con la ayuda del crédito podra seguir estudiando y seguir preparandoce para ser una buena profesional.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la falta de dinero para seguir estudiando.

El sueño es poder obtener un título  para ejercer la profesión.
En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar y dormir.
texts.en:
MARIA DEL CISNE is 23 years old, single and has one son.  She lives with her mother and 6-year-old son in Guaranda, in Bolívar province.

Maria del Cisne works in a business, in the customer service field.  She is requesting this loan to pay her college registration fees.

With the help of this loan, Maria del Cisne will be able to continue studying and continue preparing herself to become a professional.

The challenge that Maria del Cisne faces is lacking the money she needs to keep studying.

Maria del Cisne's dream is to obtain her degree so that she can work in her chosen profession.  In her free time, she enjoys relaxing and sleeping.

loans.use: to pay her college registration fees

loans.name: Rosini

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosini;La socia continua con su negocio de venta de repuestos de tractor (maquinarias pesadas), a la vez la socia continua vendiendo helados de forma ambulatoria ella reparte los helados a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia es una persona empeñosa y responsable con muchas ganas de continuar adelante por su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para elaborar helados como azucar,fruta y conservantes.
                                                      
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “RICHARY ANTEÑA” community bank which is located in Anta district, in Anta province, in Cusco department.

This member is Rosini.  She continues working in her business selling tractor (heavy machinery) parts.  She also continues selling iced treats as an itinerant vendor.  She sells the iced treats to her customers who request them.  Rosini is a determined and responsible person who has a great desire to continue making progress for the sake of her family.

Rosini is requesting this loan to buy supplies for making iced treats such as sugar, fruit and preservatives.  She is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making iced treats such as sugar, fruit and preservatives

loans.name: Lialo

texts.en:
Lialo is 24 years old, single, and supports two people in the family. He has been a wheat farmer for the last five years, earning a monthly income of KES 12,000.  He has applied for his fifth loan of  KES 90,000 from KADET LTD.  Lialo plans to acquire planting seeds, fertilizers, and ploughing services for his farm. 

The anticipated profits will help purchase another piece of farmland. His future plans are to get business success and acquire a farm tractor.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds, fertilizers, and ploughing services.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos como papa,maiz,cebada y trigo,al socia vende en el mercado desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,tambien el socio se dedica al negocio de tienda de medicinas naturales,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de estos negocios el socio saca adelante a sus hijos.El socio solicita el credito para comprar papa,maiz,cebada y trigo.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues working in his business selling products such as potatoes, corn, barley and wheat.  He also has a store where he sells natural medicines.  He works from 8.00am to 6.00pm and, through these businesses, he provides for his children.

The member is requesting this loan to buy potatoes, corn, barley and wheat.  He is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, corn, barley and wheat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase local wine.

loans.name: Henry Cristian

texts.es:
HENRY CRISTIAN tiene 28 años de edad es soltero tiene una hija de 7 años de edad, vive con los padres en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

HENRY CRISTIAN es chofer trabaja en una camioneta haciendo carreras. Solicita el crédito para gastos lista de útiles y matricula, cuadernos, esferos, borrador y los libros. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá realizar las compras para ayudarle a la hija en la educación.

Los desafíosa a los que se enfrenta es poder darle la educación hasta que ella se gradue y sea una profesional.
El sueño es poder comprar un vehículo. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar boli.
texts.en:
HENRY CRISTIAN is 28 years old, single and has a 7-year-old daughter.  He lives with his parents in Guaranda, Bolívar province.

Henry Cristian is a truck driver.  He is requesting this loan to cover his daughter's education expenses.  He will pay registration fees and buy supplies (notebooks, pens, erasers and books).

With the help of this loan, Henry Cristian will be able to make these purchases which will help his daughter in her education.  The challenge he faces is being able to provide his daughter with an education until she graduates and becomes a professional. 

Henry Cristian's dream is to be able to buy a vehicle.  In his free time, he enjoys playing volleyball.

loans.use: to pay registration fees and buy supplies (notebooks, pens, erasers and books)

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de plasticos,el socio tambien vende baldes,tinas,pelotas y articulos de limpieza,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de plasticos.El socio solicita el credito para comprar plasticos como baldes,tinas y pelotas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues working in his business selling plastic goods.  He sells buckets, tubs, balls and also cleaning supplies.  He works from 8.00am to 6.00pm and, through this business, he provides for his children.  This member's dream is to expand his business selling plastic goods.  He is requesting this loan to buy plastic goods such as buckets, tubs and balls. 

The member is happy to be receiving his loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy plastic goods such as buckets, tubs and balls

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales menores como pollos, cuyes y chanchos, la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias y también los lleva a diferentes lugares como Puerto Maldonado, la socia trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos para los animales y comprar cuyes, pollos y chanchos.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues in her business raising livestock such as chickens, guinea pigs and pigs.  She fattens the animals and then sells them in the different street markets.  She also takes them to different places such as Puerto Maldonado.  She works from 5.00am to 4.00pm and, through this business, she provides for her child.

This member's dream is to expand her business.  She is requesting this loan to buy feed for her animals and to buy guinea pigs, chickens and pigs.  She is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals and to buy guinea pigs, chickens and pigs

loans.name: Edwin Emiliano

texts.es:
EDWIN EMILIANO tiene 21 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

EDWIN EMILIANO es oficial en un transporte. Solicita el crédito para comprar un computador, impresora. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá realizar los trabajos para poder presentar en la Universidad "porque estudia en las noches". 

Los desafíos a los que se enfrebnta es la falta de trabajo. el sueño es poder comprar un auto.  en el tiempo libre le gusta descansar, escuchar música.
texts.en:
Edwin Emiliano is 21 years old. He is single and he has no children. He lives with his parents in Ventanas, Los Ríos province. 

Edwin Emiliano works in transportation. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase a computer and a printer.

With the help of the loan, he will be able to do his work in order to enter university because he studies at night. 

The challenge he faces is a lack of work. His dream is to be able to buy a car. In his free time, he likes to relax and listen to music.

loans.use: purchase a computer and a printer.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. She owns a car wash business, which has been running for four years. She began the business through the assistance of friends and family members. In addition to this business, she also sells petrol. Her main challenges are the seasonal nature of her business and water shortages; these challenges bring her business to a halt when they occur. She looks forward to opening a number of car wash centers in the future. 

She is applying for a loan of 73,050 Kenya shillings so that she can purchase a water tank and petrol for resell. Ruth would like to use the additional income from this loan to start a poultry farm.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank and petrol for resell.

loans.name: C2689 Abunzubumwe Group

texts.en:
Emertha is 34 years old, married and the leader of a group called "C2689 ABUNZUBUMWE" in the local language. In the photo, she is the one her hand raised. She works from 6 a.m to 3 p.m Monday through Friday. Emertha has 3 years of experience selling rice. 

Emertha has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more fertilizer for cultivating large quantities of rice to sell. With the profit, she will be able to save money for her future, pay school fees for her children and build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for cultivating large quantities of rice to sell.

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.en:
Arnaldo is from Cuba and the income he generates helps to support his family in the U.S. and back home in Cuba. With many years of experience as a computer technician and an expert in computer servers, Arnaldo decided to open his own business, HL Computers, Inc. He is very proud of the continued success of his business, especially during the hard economic times when many Florida storefronts closed. Additionally, he has one employee. By employing people, he feels he is able to contribute to the economy of his Miami community. 

"Thank you for the excellent service you provide. Because you were able to repair the computer onsite, at my home, I was able to receive a service without any hassle and avoid the traveling required that is hard for me to do because of my age," said one of his repeat clients. Through this client he has received many referrals and provided computer classes to her in her home. While Arnaldo has many loyal customers who continue to return to him for repeat business, he struggles to build his clientele. 

His store is in need of renovation and with this loan he will improve the store's appearance. He feels that upgrades will make customers more comfortable in the store and attract new ones as well. He said, "The loan will help generate more sales and income that will benefit my business and my family. With the loan I will be able to build a showroom and improve the store's appearance that I know will bring benefits" Arnaldo hopes to continue to grow his business and with one employee already, he is well on his way.

loans.use: to make store renovations

loans.name: Yony

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de elaboracion y venta de pan,ella lo distribuye a los diferentes lugares donde vende panes,la socia tambien vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los panes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar harina,manteca,azucar,leche y huevos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues to work in her business making and selling bread. She distributes the products in different places where bread is sold. She also sells through a delivery service from 7:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. With this business, the member wants to move ahead. Her dream is to have a business location where she can sell the bread. The member is requesting a loan to purchase flour, butter, sugar, milk and eggs. 

The member is happy about the loan and promises to make the payments.

loans.use: purchase flour, butter, sugar, milk and eggs.

loans.name: Nestor Ivan

texts.es:
Nestor Ivan tiene 20 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC Cevallos, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan del Pueblo viejo Perteneciente a Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas  a la siembra de cacao.

Nestor  se dedica a la  agricultura a la siembra de cacao , además se dedica a la cría de animales cómo pollos y cerdos.  

Solicita el crédito para poder comprar pollos y cerdos. El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder aumentar los animales criarlos y poderlos vender a un buen precio.

Los desafíos que se le presenta es la competencia y la plaga. El sueño es poder tener un negocio más grande de cría de animales.

En los tiempos libres le gusta cuidar a los animales.
texts.en:
Nestor Ivan is 20 years old, single, and has no children.  He lives with his parents in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province.  

He is a member of the Cevallos community bank, located in Recinto San Francisco that is part of San Juan del Pueblo Viejo parish in Ventanas.  The group members work as cacao farmers.  

Nestor works as a farmer planting cacao, and also raises animals such as chickens and pigs.  He is asking for this loan to purchase chickens and pigs.  The loan would help him increase the number of animals he raises, so that he can sell them for a good price.  He faces challenges such as competition and pests.  

His dream is to have a larger business raising animals.  In his free time, he likes to take care of animals.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Paola

texts.es: Paola de 30 años,  se dedica a la actividad comercial para apoyar el bienestar de su hogar. Ella vende a crédito electrodomésticos, cosméticos, ropa a crédito; también vende de contado refrescos, como gaseosas y cervezas. Desde sus 19 años, terminó estudios de bachillerato, siendo educada por su padres, personas altamente trabajadores y de buenas costumbres; por eso, con esta base de valores personales, no le fue difícil agregarlos a su gestión empresarial, cuando apoyada por su esposo, quien le suministrara el capital semilla, dio inicio a su oficio comercial. Hoy casada a los 21 años y madre de 2 e hijos en las edades de 2 y 7 años, sueña con ayudarlos a convertirse en personas exitosas y por eso se esmera en educarlos y trabajar persistentemente, para enseñarle los valores que a ella sus padres le transmitieron. Su negocio empezó hace 4 años y poco a poco, ha ido construyendo una clientela fija, que le refiere a nuevos clientes, por eso su capital de trabajo a la hora de comprar y responderles, se torna insuficiente y debe esperar recoger el dinero producto de sus cuentas por cobrar para hacerlo. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, quinto financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará un enfriador, para aumentar la venta de cervezas y refrescos que le dejan un importante volumen de utilidades y es un negocio de contado. Con sus anteriores créditos ha logrado el crecimiento de su negocio, reflejado en el incremento de sus ventas, que le han reportado mayores ingresos, para continuar avanzando en el aumento del bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Paola is 30 years old and works in her sales business in order to support her household.  She sells electrical appliances, cosmetics and clothing on credit.  She also sells drinks such as soda and beer for cash.  When she was 19 years old, Paola finished her high school education, brought up by her parents who are very hard-working people with good habits.  When her husband gave her some start-up capital, she was able to make use of these personal values to start up and manage a sales business.

Paola was married at 21 and is the mother of two children who are 2 and 7 years old.  She dreams of helping her children become successful people and so she takes care to educate them and work hard so that she can teach them the same values that her parents taught her.  Paola started her business four years ago and she has gradually attracted a number of regular customers who, in turn, refer her to new customers.  For this reason, the working capital she has with which to buy goods and respond to demand has become insufficient and she must wait to recover the money she is owed for her goods before she buys more.  For this reason, she is applying for a Kiva loan (her fifth loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo).  She will use the money to buy a chiller cabinet so that she can increase her sales of beer and soft drinks which makes her very good profits and is a cash-based business.  With her previous loans, Paola managed to increase her business.  This is reflected in her increase in sales which has made her more income and enabled her to continue making progress in improving her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy a chiller cabinet

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is 34 years old, married, the father of four children and the caretaker of two relatives. 

Jean Baptiste sells various beverages such as local drinks, Fanta and water. He has 5 years of experience in this work and he currently employs one person to help him. His business hours are from 7 a.m to 8 p.m every day except Sunday. 

Jean Baptiste has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various beverages such as local drinks, Fanta and water for resell. With the profit, he will be able to save money for his future, pay school fees for his children and renovate his house.

loans.use: To buy various beverages such as local drinks, Fanta and water for resell.

loans.name: Mery Carolina

texts.es:
La socia Mery continua con su negocio de multi servicios ,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia su negocio,la socia vende productos de libreria,internet y productos de belleza,la socia es una persona alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de continuar adelante por su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia para su negocio como perfumes y colonias.
texts.en:
Mery continues working in her multi-service business.  She has been in this business for years and it is doing well thanks to the hard work that she puts in.  every day.  Mery sells stationery products, provides Internet services and sells beauty products.  She is a cheerful and responsible person who has a great desire to continue making progress for the sake of her family.

Mery is requesting this loan to buy merchandise for her business (perfume and cologne).

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business such as perfume and cologne

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a self-declared decoration fanatic. After she got divorced, Ana and her daughter moved to Orlando where she opened her own window treatment business, My Blinds Today. 

She specializes in providing clients with fine quality window coverings at deeply discounted prices. She is an energetic saleswoman and if she stands in front of a window she will immediately try and sell you the best blind. Technically, she is in charge of client visits, design drawings and order placement, but don't be surprised if she is also helping the contractor with the final installation. 

Ana will use this loan to buy an industrial table which will enable her to cut the blinds herself and increase her profit margin on each project. With this cutting table, she will be able to get better prices on fabric and finalize orders in her house. As her business continues to grow, Ana continues to masterfully juggle the demands of work and single-parenting.

loans.use: purchase an industrial table to cut blinds

loans.name: Enrique

texts.en:
Enrique, an expert furniture maker, has specialized in cabinets, book cases and office furniture for over ten years now. He is truly as master with wood and utilizes his carpentry skills to build doors and floors for his customers. He has a storefront location in Florida with a shop where he produces all his original pieces. 

His business has expanded since its early days of operation and he now employs two people on a project basis. Enrique, however, has very outdated equipment which has dramatically slowed down his production and limited the types of pieces he can produce. With the purchase of a new table saw, compressor and edge banding machine he will be able to increase his work capacity and expand his repertoire. 

He originally opened his business because he had a strong desire to be self-employed. His success has allowed him to support his wife and children, and send money home to Nicaragua to support his extended family there. He hopes that in the future these machines will enable him to take on new and exciting projects, and allow him to continue to employ people and contribute to his Florida community.

loans.use: to purchase a table saw, compressor and edge banding machine

loans.name: Ednah

texts.en:
