Ednah lives in the Coastal town of Mombasa, Kenya. She owns a clothing store, which has been operating for two years. She started the business through a loan from her sister. Her main business challenge is the lack of on time payments by some customers. Despite this, Ednah is determined to grow the business and be in a position to open other stores in the future. 

She was introduced to Milango by her friends and is requesting a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of clothes. The additional income from this loan will help her restock the shop.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of clothes.

loans.name: Marilyn Atenas

texts.es:
Marilyn es una mujer de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha en casa de sus padres con su pequeño hijo de un año, lastimosamente por diversas circunstancias hace las veces de padre y madre para su pequeño ya que es madre soltera;  a pesar de su corta edad ella siempre ha sido muy trabajadora, empeñosa y entusiasta; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y la necesidad de solventar sus gastos tuvo que dejar sus estudios universitarios de Economía, pero sueña con poder retomarlos muy pronto; en sus ratos libres le gusta relajarse escuchando un poco de música y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra para compartir con su familia.
Gracias al apoyo de sus padres y a su gran deseo de superarse y salir adelante, Marilyn trabaja como operadora de maquinas en un tragamonedas de su ciudad donde labora un aproximado de 9 horas diarias, ella se siente a gusta en su trabajo ya que la consideran mucho por su buen desempeño y trato amable hacia los demás.
Marilyn se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la puesta en marcha de su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa por pedidos, con la ayuda podrá comprar la mercadería necesaria, tales como: polos, chompas, pantalones, buzos, entre otros; de esta manera Marylin espera poder contar con más ingresos económicos, los cuales desea poder utilizar para terminar de construir su vivienda de material noble y así poder asegurar el bienestar y futuro de su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Marilyn is 21 years old and lives in the city of Chincha in her parent's house with her one year old son.  Unfortunately, due to various circumstances, she has to be both father and mother for her son since she is a single mother.  Despite her young age, she has always been very hardworking, enterprising, and enthusiastic.  Due to a lack of financial resources and the need to meet her expenses, she had to leave her university studies in Economics, but she hopes to restart them soon.  In her free time, she likes to relax and listen to music and sometimes cooks a rich carapulcra (meat and potato stew) to share with her family.

Thanks to the support of her parents and her desire to excel and succeed, Marilyn works as a slot machine operator in her city about nine hours a day.  She likes this work since she is well regarded for her good performance and her friendliness towards people.  

Marilyn is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to their help she will be able to launch her small business selling clothing.  With the help of this loan, she will purchase the necessary merchandise, such as polo shirts, sweaters, pants, sportswear, and other items.  Marilyn hopes that this business will provide more income, which she can use to finish building her house with good materials, and assure the well-being and future of her small son.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as polo shirts, sweaters, pants, and sportswear.

loans.name: Jesus Deliva

texts.es:
Jesús Deliva tiene 58 años de edad, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

VRC CEVALLOS, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO SAN FRANCISCO, PERTENECE A LA PARROQUIA SAN JUAN DE PUEBLO VIEJO SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS.

Jesús Deliva se dedica a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para compra de cerdos, pollos. 

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar mas animales para seguir criando. Realiza sus compras en Babahoyo y ventas en la ciudad de Ventanas y San Juan.

El sueño es tener un negocio mas grande. El desafío al que se enfrenta es dificultades por el dinero.

En su tiempo libre se dedica a sus animales y a su hogar.
texts.en:
Jesús Deliva is 58 years old. She is single and she lives in the city of Ventanas in the Los Ríos province.

The Cevallos community bank is located in the recinto San Francisco in the San Juan de Pueblo Viejo parish. They work in agriculture.

Jesús Deliva raises chickens and pigs. She is requesting a loan to purchase pigs and chickens. 

With the support of the loan, she will be able to purchase more animals in order to continue raising them. She makes her purchases in Babahoyo and makes sales in the cities of Ventanas and San Juan. 

Her dream is to have a bigger business. The challenge she faces is difficulties with money.

In her free time, she focuses on her animal and her home.

loans.use: purchase pigs and chickens.

loans.name: C18540 Urugwiro Group

texts.en:
Vestine is 56 years old, married, the mother of two children between 14 years and 17 years old and the caretaker of one 12-year-old relative. 

Vestine is a leader of a group called "C18540 URUGWIRO" in the local language. In the photo, she's the one sitting in front of the others. She works from 7 a.m to 9 p.m daily except on Sunday. She sells various goods such as bananas, beans, potatoes and maize; Vestine has 15 years of experience in this work and she currently employs one person to help her.

Vestine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various food items such as beans, potatoes and bananas for resell. With the profits, she will be able to save money for her future and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy various goods such as bananas, beans, potatoes, maize for resell.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is a fish monger at Eguafo near Elmina. She buys fish from the market and then fries them for sale. Esi has been in this business for 15 years now. She is married to a farmer and has six children. Esi uses her income to help her husband in paying their utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase more fish to fry and then sell. With the new profit, Esi wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to fry and then sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa desde que recibió su anterior credikiva, está muy contenta porque invirtió en artículos de plata, fantasía, jeans y mercancía variada como suéteres, calzado etc. Con ello ha logrado nuevos ingresos y también está invirtiendo en otro negocio de venta de cárnicos, en el que le está yendo muy bien; para poder responder a su clientela de estos últimos productos y tener exactamente lo que sus clientes necesitan, debe esperar a recoger su cartera de cuentas por cobrar de su mercancia,  para invertir en su otro negocio . Por eso nuevamente acude a un credikiva, con el cual comprará productos cárnicos principalmente y algunas mercancías que han solicitado sus clientes, como artículos de plata y oro golfi. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Le doy Gracias a Kiva por esa labor que está haciendo: la de prestarle a personas de escasos recursos económicos, para tener una entrada mas, para mejorar la calidad de vida y seguir prosperando en el negocio”
texts.en: Rosa has been very happy since she received her previous Kiva loan because she invested it in silver jewelry, costume jewelry, jeans and a variety of other merchandise such as sweaters, shoes, etc.  This made her new income and she is also now investing in a new business selling meat products which is doing very well.  In order to meet her customer demand for these products and to have in stock exactly what her customers need, she must wait to collect money on her outstanding accounts in order to invest in this other business.  For this reason, she is applying for a new Kiva loan which she will mainly use to buy meat products and some other merchandise that her customers have requested such as silver- and gold-plated jewelry.  Her message to Kiva lenders is the following: "I would like to thank Kiva for the work that they are doing: lending to people with limited financial means so that they can have another income with which to improve their quality of life and continue to thrive in their business".

loans.use: to buy meat products and other merchandise that her customers have requested such as silver- and gold-plated jewelry

loans.name: Irma Eloisa

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Irma; La socia continua con su negocio de elaboracion de tamales hechos a base de maiz,la socia vende los tamales de forma ambulatoria para todos sus clientes que le solicitan , a la vez continua con su negocio de compra y venta de madera,la socia es una persona bien empeñosa con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de mas madera para su negocio.
texts.en:
Irma continues her business making corn tamales.  She sells them on the street to all of her customers who request them.  At the same time, she continues with her business buying and selling wood.  Irma is an enterprising person who wants to continue working for her family.  

Irma is requesting this loan to purchase more wood for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more wood for her business.

loans.name: Diana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Diana Elizabeth tiene veintiún años de edad es soltera tiene tres hijos, vive con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

VRC CEVALLOS, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO SAN FRANCISCO, PERTENECE A LA PARROQUIA SAN JUAN DE PUEBLO VIEJO SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS.

Diana Elizabeth se dedica a la agriculturaa la crianza de animales como gallinas y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar animales cómo pollos y cerdos.

Con el apoyo del crédito va a comprar mas animales para criar y luego venderlos a un buen precio. Realiza sus compras en la ciudad de Babahoyo y ventas en la ciudad de San Juan y en Ventanas.

El sueño de la señora es agrandar el negocio.El desafío al que se enfrenta la señora es la falta de dinero para poder comprar los animales.

En su tiempo libre se dedica a sus animales y a su hogar.
texts.en:
Diana Elizabeth is 21 years old, single and has three children.  She lives with her children in Ventanas canton, in los Ríos province.

The Cevallos community bank is located in San Francisco, in San Juan de Pueblo Viejo parish.  The members of this community bank work in agriculture.

Diana Elizabeth's business is raising animals such as hens and pigs.  She is requesting this loan to buy chickens and pigs.

With the support of this loan, she will buy more animals to raise and then sell at a good price.  She makes her purchases in the town of Babahoyo and makes her sales in San Juan and Ventanas.

Diana Elizabeth's dream is to expand her business.  The difficulty she faces is a lack of money with which to buy animals.

In her free time, Diana Elizabeth takes care of her animals and her home.

loans.use: to buy chickens and pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 40 bags of rice and pay for transportation.

loans.name: Maria Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Maria; La socia continua dedicandose al negocio de compra y venta de quesos,moraya y papa,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de mas quesos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria continues in her business buying and selling cheese, 'moraya' (a freeze-dried potato product) and potatoes.  She has been in this business for a long time and it is doing well thanks to the hard work that she puts in every day.  Maria is a responsible and determined person who has a great desire to continue working for the sake of her family.

Maria is requesting this loan to buy more cheese for her business.

loans.use: to buy more cheese for her business

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Osman.  He is married and has three children aged 25, 17, and 6. He has two additional dependents who live with him and also supports their schooling.  In 1989, Osman established his junk business. He began his business immediately after he completed his fifth form, and his parents did not have money to support him in furthering his education. Therefore, he decided to assist his friends in business until the time when he got some capital to establish his own business. 

Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 2,000,000 Sierra Leone leone (SLL) every month. He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Osman has already received and successfully repaid a loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy 10 bales of used clothing at 450,000 SLL and the balance will be used for transportation.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 1,000,000 SLL. In the future, Osman plans to establish his business in the provinces. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy 10 bales of used clothing at 450,000 SLL.

loans.name: Rosaira

texts.es: Rosaira con su anterior credikiva compró muchos articulos variados y respondió a los pedidos de su clientela, ella vendió vestuario femenio, ropa para hombre, productos de belleza y mercancias que en sus catalogos ofrecieron con descuentos especiales. Su negocio logró mayor movilidad en sus inventarios y en sus cuentas por cobrar,  porque estas últimas aumentaron. En la actualidad necesita invertir aun mas en su negocio, para agregar un nuevo capital de trabajo y poder comprar articulos de tocador, accesorios femeninos, colonias, articulos de aseo, que le ayudan a rotar sus ventas rapidamente. Su mensaje a los finaciadores de Kiva es el siguiente: " Quiero agradecerle por el apoyo recibido de Kiva, porque gracias a ellos he podido incrementar el capital y sacar mi negocio adelante. "
texts.en: Rosaira used her previous Kiva loan to buy a lot of different goods and she was able to fill her customers' orders.  She sold ladies' clothing, men's clothing, beauty products and merchandise which was available in her catalogs at special discounts.  She managed to improve her stock turnover and increase her accounts receivable.  She currently needs to invest even further in her business, adding new working capital so that she can buy personal care products, women's accessories, colognes and toiletries.  This will help her to achieve a quick sales turnover.  Her message to Kiva lenders is as follows: I would like to thank you for the support I have received from Kiva.  Thanks to you, I have been able to increase my capital and make progress in my business".

loans.use: to buy personal care products, women's accessories, colognes and toiletries

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita es socia del Bancomunal Violeta y tiene 61 años de edad, es viuda es madre de un hijo varón. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 16 años y es profesora jubilada, ella tiene su propio restaurante donde se vende platos típicos del Perú, también tiene un negocio donde se vende gas.  En todo este tiempo como socia de FINCA Perú, Margarita con todo su esfuerzo y trabajo ha podido construir el segundo piso de su casa. Su sueño para el futuro es construir otra casa para  que la pueda alquilar. En todo este tiempo lo que mas ha aprendido es a ahorrar. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de gas para vender en su negocio.
texts.en: Margarita is a member of the Violeta community bank.  She is 61 years old, a widow and has one son.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 16 years and is a retired teacher.  She owns her own restaurant where she sells traditional Peruvian dishes.  She also has a business selling gas.  During her years as a FINCA Peru member, Margarita has worked hard and managed to add a second storey to her house.  Her dream for the future is to build another house that she can rent out.  Over all these years, what Margarita has learned the most is how to save.  She will invest the loan that she is requesting in buying gas to sell in her business.

loans.use: to buy gas to sell in her business

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena produces kenkey (a fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves) for sale. Pictured in front of Abena are the leaves she uses in covering the maize dough, which is used to make the kenkey. She is married to a farmer and has nine children. She uses her income to support her husband in paying the expenses of the family. 

Abena needs this loan to purchase bags of maize and leaves for her kenkey production. With the new profit, Abena will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and leaves for her kenkey production.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es: Cirila es socia del Bancomunal El Roble, tiene 57 años de edad y es madre 1 hijo. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 13 años y se dedica a la venta de hojas de coca para elaborar productos medicinales. Ella dice que en todo este tiempo como socia de FINCA Perú ha aprendido a ser puntual y le gustan mucho las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal ya que  aprendió muchas cosas que son innovadoras para su desarrollo personal y también para su negocio. Ella agradece los préstamos que le brindaron ya que con ellos mejoró su negocio. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de hojas de coca para venderlos en su negocio.
texts.en: Cirila is a member of the El Roble communal bank. She is 57 years old and she is the mother of one son. She has been a member FINCA Perú for 13 years. She sells coca leaves used for making medicinal products. She says that in all the time that she has been a FINCA Perú member she has learned to be punctual. She likes the training she receives at her communal bank since she has learned many things that are innovative for her personal development as well as her business’ development. She is grateful for the provided loans since they improve her business. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of coca leaves to sell in her business.

loans.use: purchase coca leaves to sell in her business

loans.name: Luz Eliana

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Luz Eliana; La socia continua con su negocio de elaboración de pan, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,la socia trabaja de forma ambulatoria vendiendo su mercaderia a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia es una persona alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia.
La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboracion de pan como manteca y harina.
texts.en:
Luz Eliana continues in her business making bread.  She has been in this business for years and it is doing well thanks to the hard work that she puts in every day.  Luz Eliana works as an itinerant vendor, selling her merchandise to customers who request it.  She is a cheerful and responsible person who has a great desire to make progress for the sake of her family.

Luz Eliana is requesting this loan to buy supplies for making her bread such as butter and flour.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making bread such as butter and flour

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells cassava and palm fruits at Asafora near Cape Coast, which she has done for 13 years now. She is a widow and has four children.  She uses her income to feed, clothe, and pay her children’s school fees. Efua will uses her loan to purchase more palm fruits and food stuffs to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruits and food stuffs to sell.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells maize at Asafora near Cape Coast, which she has done for four years now.  She is married and has two children. Ekua uses her income to support her husband in feeding the family and paying their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase bags of maize to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Ekua wants to cultivate the maize she sells herself.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize to  sell.

loans.name: Maria Carmela

texts.es: María es socia del Bancomunal Llamkasum y tiene 82 años de edad, es casada y es madre de 6 hijos (cuatro mujeres y dos varones). Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 16 años y  es dueña de su propia tienda donde se vende abarrotes. Ella dice que su experiencia en FINCA Perú ha sido muy buena, tiene sus ahorros y su meta es siempre aumentarlos y la institución le ha ayudado a progresar. Su sueño para el futuro es continuar ahorrando para el resto de su vida. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para su tienda como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, fideos, menestras.
texts.en: María is a member of the Llamkasum community bank.  She is 82 years old, married and the mother of 6 children (four daughters and two sons).  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 16 years and owns her own store where she sells groceries.  She says that her experience with FINCA Peru has been very good.  She has savings and her goal is to always increase them.  The institution has helped her to make progress.  María's dream for the future is to continue saving for the rest of her life.  She will invest the loan that she is requesting in buying groceries for her store such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, noodles and mixed vegetables.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her store such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, noodles and mixed vegetables

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua lives with her husband and three children in Asafora  near Cape Coast. She has sold maize for 10 years now. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their utility and housing costs. Ekua will use her loan to purchase bags of maize to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Ekua wants to cultivate her own maize to sell.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize to sell.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is a single parent with four children. For the past 21 years, she has been selling soap and rice at Asafora, near Cape Coast. As a single parent, Esi uses her income to feed and clothe her children as well as pay their school fees. 

Esi is requesting a loan to purchase boxes of soap and bags of rice to sell. With her new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of soap and bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells cooking utensils and saucepans at Safora near Cape Coast.  She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. Ekua has been selling home products for some years now. With her income, she supports her husband in paying their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase more cooking utensils and saucepans to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop for the sale of her cooking utensils.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking utensils and saucepans to sell.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is a fishmonger. She buys fresh fish from the market, smokes them and then sells them. Ekua has been selling smoked fish for 10 years now. She is married with three children. She uses her income to support her husband in feeding and clothing their children. Ekua will use her loan to purchase fresh  fish to smoke and sell. She plans to use her new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase fresh fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Elizabeta

texts.en:
Elizabeta is a 25-year-old Roma woman from the Romani ethnic community of Northern Albania. She is married and has two children who are 1 1/2 and 5 years old. She has been selling used clothes, different accessories and kitchenware items for the past four years. Elizabeta and her family live in a barrack with metal sheet roofing and cardboard on the floor without a toilet or running water. Many Roma still live in such conditions in Albania and you would wonder how they survive.
Elizabeta is applying for a Kiva loan through VisionFund Albania to buy more used clothes inventory in order to increase her sales. This is her second loan. She successfully paid off her previous loan. With any profits that she will be able to save, Elizabeta will build a little house to live a normal life.
She is very appreciative for the opportunity she has been granted, because this loan will really be a great help to her and most importantly to her children.

loans.use: to buy used clothes and accessories and houseware items to sell.

loans.name: Monica Isabel

texts.es:
Mónica Isabel tiene 32 años vive en unión libre tiene un hijo, vive con el esposo y con el hijo de ocho años de edad en el Cantón ventanas provincia de los ríos.

VRC CEVALLOS, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO SAN FRANCISCO, PERTENECE A LA PARROQUIA SAN JUAN DE PUEBLO VIEJO SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS. 

Mónica Isabel  se dedica a la crianza de animales como gallinas y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para compra de animales cómo pollos, cerdos, patos.
Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar mas animales para críarlos y poder venderlos a un buen precio.

Realiza sus compras en Babahoyo, vende en San Juan, Ventanas y Babahoyo.

El sueño de la señora es comprar más animales y que el negocio cresca. El desafío al que se enfrenta es la dcompetencia.
En su tiempo libre se dedica a sus animales y a limpiar la casa.
texts.en:
Mónica Isabel is 32 years old. She is  in a common-law relationship. She has a son. She lives with her husband and her eight year old son in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province. 

The Cevallos community bank is located in the recinto San Francisco in the San Juan de Pueblo Viejo parish. They work in agriculture.

Mónica Isabel raises chickens and pigs. She is requesting a loan to purchase animals like chickens, pigs and ducks. 

With the help of the loan, she will be able to purchase more animals in order to raise them and sell them at a good price.

She makes her purchases in Babahoyo. She sells in San Juan, Ventanas y Babahoyo.

Her dreams are to purchase more animals and for her business to grow. The challenge she faces is competition. 
In her free time, she focuses on her animals and cleaning her house.

loans.use: purchase animals like chickens, pigs and ducks.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells maize and cassava at Asafora near Cape Coast. She has done so for three years now.  Ama is married and has four children. She uses her income to help her husband feed the family and pay their children’s school fees.  Ama will use her loan to purchase bags of maize and cassava to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Ama wants to cultivate the maize and cassava she sells herself.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua produces fanti kenkey (fermented maize dough wrapped in banana leaves) for sale in Asafora near Cape Coast. Pictured in front of Ekua is the maize dough she uses in producing her kenkey.  She is married and has nine children. Her husband is a farmer. Ekua has been selling fanti kenkey for 20 years now. She uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of their family. Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize for the production of her kenkey. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy maize for the production of her kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is a fishmonger and also sells cooking utensils and saucepans at Safora, near Cape Coast. She is married and has four children. Ekua has been selling these items for some years now.  She supports her husband in paying their children’s school fees.  Ekua will use her loan to purchase more cooking utensils and saucepans to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop for the sale of her cooking utensils.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking utensils and saucepans to sell

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is married with three children. For the past four years, she has been a fish monger, buying fresh fish from the market to smoke and sell. Efua uses her income to help her husband feed and clothe their children. 

Efua is requesting a loan to purchase fresh fish to smoke and sell. She will use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 39-year-old married woman with three children whose ages range from seven to 16. For the past two years, she has operated a store where she sells shoes. Florence describes herself as a visionary, aggressive, and determined woman. Her business is located in an ideal business location and her primary customers are local residents. Her major biggest business challenge is having insufficient funds to improve her business. 

Florence is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to buy more shoes to sell. Her business goal is to open many more retail shoe stores within five years. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to import shoes from outside the country.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is a fishmonger. She buys fresh fish from the market and fries them to sell.  Esi has been selling fried fish for five years now. She is married and has five children.  Esi uses her income to help her husband feed and clothe their children. She will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to fry and sell. Esi will expand her business with her new profits.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to fry and sell.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba is married with five children. For the past 11 years, she has been operating a chop bar, a cafe where she prepares and sells a variety of African dishes. She is seen scooping soup from a pot to serve her customers. Araba makes fufu, banku, meat soup, fish soup, and rice balls. She uses her income to support her husband and pay their children’s school fees. 

Araba is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients such as maize, cassava, meat, fish, and other items to prepare food for sale. She plans to open a restaurant with her new profit.

loans.use: to purchase maize, cassava, meat, fish, and other ingredients to prepare food to sell

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is a fish monger.  She buys fresh fish from the market and fries them for sale.  Abena has been selling fried fish for five years now.  She is married with five children.  She uses her income to support her husband and to feed and cloth their children.  Abena will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to fry for sale.  Abena will expand her business with the new profit.

loans.use: purchase fresh fish to fry for sale.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is married with five children. For the past five years, she has been buying fresh fish from the market and frying it to sell. Abena uses her income to support her husband to feed and clothe their children.  

Abena is requesting a loan to purchase fresh fish to fry and sell. She will use her new profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to fry and sell

loans.name: Marije

texts.en:
Nazire is 36 years old and married.  She has two children: one is thirteen and the other is eleven years old. They all live in the northwest part of the country. She has studied dress making and fashion design and has been in business for the past three years renting a little tailoring shop.  She finds herself being busy and happy at the same time with the workload and says beaming, “It works just perfectly with me.” 
Considering the demand for her tailoring services, Nazire wants to expand her business by buying textile raw material. With the profit, she wants to invest in a good sized store.
She has been referred to the institutions from her relatives who are VisionFund’s Albania clients. She hopes that her wish of expanding her services will be fulfilled with the support from Kiva lenders and she thanks them in advance.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for textiles.

loans.name: Lilean

texts.en: Lilean is a 24 year old married woman.  She has a son who is one years old.  She describes herself to be a social and a talkative woman.  She operates a beauty salon where she provides hair services.  She has been involved in this business for three years and employs one staff member.  Her business is located within a busy town and her primary customers are women.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be frequent power outages . She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a blowdrying machine.  Her business goal is to run many salon in her home town within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children with thegains from the business.

loans.use: to buy a blow drying machine.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.es: Jenifer es socia del Bancomunal Llamkasum, tiene 27 años de edad y es madre soltera de 1 hija. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 3 años y trabaja haciendo repostería, además cada sábado viaja a las ferias para traer cereales y venderlos en su distrito. Ella manifiesta que su experiencia en FINCA Perú ha sido muy buena ya que la apoyan cuando necesita dinero para invertir en su negocio y otras instituciones no le brindan las mismas facilidades. Su sueño para el futuro es brindarle una buena educación a su hija y mejorar su calidad de vida  así como la de su hija. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más cereales para vender como quinua, quiwicha, trigo.
texts.en: Jenifer is a member of the Llamkasum community bank.  She is 27 years old and the single mother of one daughter.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for three years and works making confectionery.  In addition, every Saturday she travels to street markets to buy cereals which she then takes back home and sells in her district.  She says that her experience with FINCA Peru has been very good because they support her whenever she needs money to invest in her business and other institutions do not provide her with the same facilities.  Her dream for the future is to provide her daughter with a good education and improve her own quality of life as well as her daughter's.  She will invest the loan that she is requesting in buying more cereals to sell such as quinoa, amaranth and wheat.

loans.use: to buy more cereals to sell (quinoa, amaranth and wheat)

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua lives together with her husband who is a farmer and seven dependents at Asafora near the Cape Coast. Efua is a fish monger. She buys fresh fish from the market and fries them for sale.  Efua has been selling fried fish for 15 years now.  She uses her income to support her husband and feed and cloth their children.  Efua will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to fry for sale.  Efua will expand her business with the new profit.

loans.use: purchase fresh fish to fry for sale.

loans.name: Pjeter

texts.en:
Pjeter is 48 years old and married. He has three children, two of whom are still attending school. The oldest child is 22 and the youngest 17 years old. 

Pjeter has been running a dairy farm and animal sales business for 16 years so he has plenty of experience. This is his first time requesting a Kiva loan via VisionFund Albania. With this loan, he will purchase a cow with a calf, because he wants to expand his business since he has a steady clientele. With any profits, Pjeter will be able to save for reconstructing their current family house. Current VisionFund's Albania clients who have referred him to us comment on his responsible nature. Pjeter thanks potential lenders in advance for their support.

loans.use: To purchase a cow with a calf

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells doughnuts, which she has done for 5 years. Efua is married and has five children.  She uses her income to support her husband in paying for her children’s school fees.  Efua will use her loan to purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil for her doughnut-making business.  With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil for her doughnut.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; La  socia vive en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Elisa;la socia continua dedicandose a la compra y venta de ropa,como casacas, pantalones, chompas entre otros,la socia trabaja de forma ambulatoria vendiendo su mercaderia a sus amistades y familiares que le solicitan,la socia es una persona alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia como casacas.
texts.en:
This member is part of the “QORI ORCCO” communal bank and lives in the district of Urcos, in the Quispicanchis province and the department of Cusco.
	
The member in question, Elisa, continues to work by buying and selling clothes such as jackets, trousers and jumpers among others. She works as a street vendor selling her merchandise to her friends and relatives who ask her for it. Elisa is a happy and responsible person with a keen desire to get ahead for her family. The member requests the loan to buy merchandise such as jackets.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as jackets.
